meanings.definition: Free from an obligation or liability imposed on others.
meanings.sent1: The student was exempted from the final exam due to a medical condition.
meanings.sent2: The exempted workers did not have to attend the mandatory training session.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed exempted from the rule of not jumping on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an exempted melody in the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a peaceful exempted sanctuary amidst the bustling city.

meanings.definition: To release or excuse from a duty or requirement.
meanings.sent1: The teacher exempted Sarah from the group project as she was sick.
meanings.sent2: He exempted himself from jury duty by providing a valid reason.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to exempt the rabbit from the hat trick, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The sun exempted the flowers from the cold with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture exempted him from any further punishment.
